column2: An easy, flexible way to add a shimmering effect to any view in an Android app.

column5: message

Adopt Contributor Covenant

Summary:
In order to foster healthy open source communities, we're adopting the
[Contributor Covenant](https://www.contributor-covenant.org/). It has been
built by open source community members and represents a shared understanding of
what is expected from a healthy community.

Ensure the shader exists before attempting to draw

Differential Revision: D8789279

fbshipit-source-id: f8393d1d3022d4268a37f13318e7c73f52b351af

Use matrix transformations to draw the shimmer instead of rotating a drawn rect

Summary: Instead of trying to compute the correct size of the shimmer draw rect by an incorrect heuristic, we instead apply a matrix transformation to the shader. This means we dont have to calculate a specially sized draw rect to ensure we cover the entire view, but it does mean that we need to enlongate the translation distance by the opposite dimension of the right triangle that is formed with the shimer's tilt and the non primary axis.

Reviewed By: sjkirby

Summary:
After translation, rotation pivot (width/2, height/2) doesn't correspond to the center of mDrawRect, which leads to an incorrect mDrawRect position.
Perform translation after rotation to fix the issue.

fbshipit-source-id: 651ec3c755d265d54769ee3f6c62151698dfbab7

Rewrite ShimmerFrameLayout to be much more performant

Summary:
A rewrite of shimmer to take into account memory/perf issues

The previous version of shimmer would require 3 extra bitmaps to achieve its visual effect.
This version only requires 1 extra hardware layer for views that contain transparency and 0 for those that do
not. This significantly reduces memory consumption in both the Java world and GPU world. It also increases performance.

It does this by taking advantage of the ability compose the effect via a Paint + hardware layer + Porter Duff xfer modes.
In the case of fully opaque views, the shimmer is simply drawn on top of the content.

A preliminary check of the effects of this implementation on the sample app show a 15MB reduction in Java heap usage.

Reviewed By: sjkirby
